TITLE: Russia withdraws its troops from a key city encircled by Ukrainian forces
SUMMARY: Russia pulled troops out Saturday from the eastern Ukrainian city of Lyman, which it had been using as a front-line hub. It was the latest victory for the Ukrainian counteroffensive.

TITLE: Gunfire erupts in Burkina Faso a day after the second coup in nine months
SUMMARY: Gunshots rang out in Burkina Faso's capital amid signs of lingering tensions a day after a group of military officers overthrew the man who had seized power in a coup in January.

TITLE: The Ice Bucket Challenge wasn't just for social media. It helped fund a new ALS drug
SUMMARY: In 2014, it was hard to miss the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge that set out to raise money to fund research for the disease. And it paid off. A new treatment was funded by $2.2 million of the funds raised.

TITLE: Brazil's election could determine the fate of the Amazon after record deforestation
SUMMARY: Under President Jair Bolsonaro, who is running for reelection in Sunday's vote, forest clearing and wildfires have surged in the Amazon.

TITLE: Russia accused of 'kidnapping' head of Ukraine nuclear plant
SUMMARY: Russian forces seized the director-general of the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant on Friday, Ukrainian state nuclear company Energoatom said.

TITLE: Campaign signs influence how we vote more than you might realize
SUMMARY: Especially in local races, political signs can drive name recognition in important ways. In one study, they even helped elevate a fictitious candidate to near the front of the pack.

TITLE: An Arizona judge won't suspend her ruling that halted abortions in the state
SUMMARY: An Arizona judge on Friday declined to put her order that allowed enforcement of a pre-statehood law making it a crime to provide an abortion on hold.

TITLE: With Ukraine at war, officials hope to bring tourism back to areas away from fighting
SUMMARY: The war displaced millions of Ukrainians. But officials are trying to entice citizens to travel around the country for pleasure again.

TITLE: What it's like serving a life sentence in prison with no chance of release
SUMMARY: When Calvin Duncan was 19 years old, he was arrested for a murder he didn't commit. Now, he's helping to tell the stories of other men who have found themselves behind bars for life.

TITLE: In the wake of Hurricane Ian's destruction, Floridians are picking up the pieces
SUMMARY: Days after Category 4 Hurricane Ian came ashore near the tony seaside community, residents are taking stock and trying to put their lives back together.

TITLE: How local and national leaders are tested by major natural disasters
SUMMARY: If handled well, storms like Hurricane Ian can cement politicians' images as community leaders — competent and trusted to help constituents get what they need. If mishandled, they can mar legacies.

TITLE: A bad year for Wall Street gets even worse, as stock markets finish September down
SUMMARY: Amid heightened uncertainty about the global economy, all three U.S. indexes are in a bear market as the third quarter comes to a close.

TITLE: Jackson, Miss., residents struggle with basic needs as the water crisis disrupts life
SUMMARY: Residents in the predominantly Black city confront chronic water system outages that have them finding ways to function without a basic public service – safe and reliable drinking water.

TITLE: North Korea conducts 4th round of missile tests in 1 week
SUMMARY: North Korea on Saturday test-fired two short-range ballistic missiles, its neighbors said, prompting quick, strong condemnation from its rivals.

TITLE: Dozens are dead from Ian, one of the strongest and costliest U.S. storms
SUMMARY: The powerful storm terrorized millions for most of the week, hitting western Cuba before raking across Florida and then South Carolina.
